content: 220 fingerless mitt s i came up with this pattern after searching high and low for a fingerless mitten pattern that gave me a nice tight fabric with this common yarn it s done in a nice stretchy ribbing so it should fit just about any average sized person man or woman i designed these for my teenage brothers but they also fit me just fine i put stripes in mine you can go plain or pick some leftovers from your stash and go crazy mmmmaaaatttteeeerrrriiiiaaaallllssss cascade 220 1 hank nnnneeeeeeeeddddlllleeeessss us size 4 3 5mm ggggaaaauuuuggggeeee 12 stitches and 15 row per 2 inches k1 knit one p1 purl one m1 make one pm place marker sm slip marker ddddiiiirrrreeeeccccttttiiiioooonnnnssss cast on 42 stitches i use long tail cast on you want it to be stretchy work k2 p1 rib for 3-1/4 i got 23 row start thumb shaping these mittens are generic you can wear either mitt on either hand prepround k2 pm m1 p1 m1 pm continue in pattern to end **round 1 k2 sm m1 k to center stitch purl center stitch knit to marker m1 sm knit in pattern to end **round 2 & 3 knit in pattern **repeat these three row until you have 15 stitches between your markers for the thumb knit 2 more row in pattern knit around in pattern when you get to the thumb stitches place them on some waste yarn and cast on one stitch in it s place i used backwards loop method do as you choose knit 12 more row in pattern or until desired length cast off loosely now you need to go back and pick up the thumb stitches that you have on waste yarn you will also want to pick up 3 stitches in the gap at the top of the thumb this could be more or less… just make sure there are no gaps knit 6 row in pattern cast off loosely in pattern and there you have a pair of simple mittens that will fit almost anyone
